climbs.name: To Far North For The Migrating Munchkin
climbs.fa: Tony Lusk, Tony Hornass, Andy T, Dave Week's,'07

content.description: The crux is on the upper headwall with great exposure.

climbs.name: Thought's of Strassman And Cochise
climbs.fa: Tony lusk, Tony Hornass, Andy T, '07

content.description: This climb is a tribute to the Late Mike Strassman! Another route not to be missed on this wall. Excellent rock and exposure will make this a memorable one for anyone new to climbing.
content.location: First route left of Cave Dweller's

climbs.name: Surfing With the Alien
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, Andy Tretiakoff,Joe Satriani

content.description: Crux at the top of the climb with face climbing down low

climbs.name: Sons of Plunder
climbs.fa: 2008 Tony Lusk, Dennis Cozzetti, Tony Horness

content.description: Better done if linked up with the upper pitch of AT Steps Out for 195' of climbing

climbs.name: Smokin Stealth
climbs.fa: 2008 Dennis Cozzetti, Tony Lusk, Mary Johns

content.description: Stiff face climb joins 7 Year Itch to go to midpoint anchors.  Dennis smoked a pair of 5.10 shoes developing the climb hence the name
content.location: 5th route from the right (east) side of the wall

climbs.name: Frictional Character
climbs.fa: 2008 Dennis Cozzetti, Tony Lusk, Mary Johns

content.description: Joins Munchkin to mid point anchors.  Another face climb
content.location: 4th route from the right (east) side of the wall

climbs.name: Cave Dweller's
climbs.fa: Andy Tretiakoff, Tony lusk, Tony Hornass, '07

content.description: Long and continuous easy climbing with several well protected crux's.
content.location: Far east end of the tall Wall. Can be done as 1 long pitch with a walkoff near the cave or lower off anchor's at 100 Ft.

climbs.name: Biaxident
climbs.fa: 2008 Tony Horness, Tony Lusk, John Petrucci

content.description: Slab start to headwall finish.  This originally was going to be a variation of SWTA but might be a better climb!

climbs.name: Ben Dover
climbs.fa: 2008 Kent Bruner, Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff

content.location: 1st route on the left (west) side of the wall

climbs.name: AT Steps Out
climbs.fa: 2007 Andy Tretiakoff, Tony Lusk, Tony Horness

content.description: Face climbing start with vertical finish.  This was the last climb Andy was part of due to a torn ACL at Jackson Hole ski resort in January of 2008

climbs.name: 7 Year Itch
climbs.fa: 2007 Tony Lusk, Tony Horness, Andy Tretiakoff

content.description: Tony Lusk's first FA in 7 years and the first route at the outcroppings.  Fun route with good exposure
content.location: 6th route from the left - pretty much right in the middle of the wall

content.description:
This wall is a southern facing low angle wall.  It is a great place to climb early in the morning during the summer and all day from fall to spring.  Many of the climbs have been done with snow at the base in a light fleece and wind pants.   

  Most of the routes are 195' with chains at 95' and chains at the top.  The routes can all be done as single pitches or in two 95' pitches.  These were the first routes bolted at the area.  The rock is top quality with nice exposure and over 1755' of vertical climbing on this wall.  Bring your quickdraws - you need at least 22 quick draws to these routes in one long pitch!! 

  All of these routes require a 60 meter rope.  Danger, don't bring any short ropes here!  Do not belay from the log below the ledge - you will not have enough rope with a 60 meter rope.  Use the safety bolt on the ledge for SWTA, Biaxident and 7 Year Itch
